questionsData.explain_answer: A person who asks for a job is applicant .

questionsData.title: . Exhausted and extremely are antonyms
questionsData.explain_answer:
"Exhausted" and "extremely" are not antonyms  and not synonyms , they are actually unrelated terms.

"Exhausted" is an adjective that means feeling very tired .

Ex : I'm exhausted after running that marathon.

Extremely means to a very great degree.

Ex : She was extremely tired

. We can study the leathers of birds to understand how they fly
questionsData.explain_answer:
. We can study the feathers of birds to understand how they fly

Bird feathers, not leathers, are the key focus when studying avian flight. Feathers have unique structures, shapes, and functions that enable birds to achieve flight. The study of feathers provides valuable insights into aerodynamics, lift, maneuverability, and other aspects of bird flight.

questionsData.title: . In gas state, particles are apart and move fast
. A smooth white surface reflects less light than the black one
questionsData.explain_answer:
A smooth white surface reflects more light than a smooth black surface.

  • Color and Light Interaction: The color of an object depends on the wavelengths of light it reflects and absorbs.

    • White objects: Reflect most of the visible light spectrum, giving them a bright appearance.
    • Black objects: Absorb most of the visible light spectrum, appearing dark.

questionsData.title: ….. What does the right chamber do ? It receives
questionsData.article: The human heart is divided into four chambers. The artria are the thin-walled upper chambers that gather blood as it flows from the veins between heartbeats. The ventricles are the thick, walled lower chambers that receive blood from the atria and push it into the arteries with each contraction of the heart. The left atrium and ventricle work separately from those on the right. The role of the chambers on the right side of the heart is to receive oxygen-depleted blood from the body tissues and send it on to the lungs, the chambers on the left side of the heart then receive the oxygen- enriched blood from the lungs and send it back out to the body tissues.

questionsData.title: John , ….. speaks French works as a tourist guide.
. The information …… given to the police
questionsData.explain_answer:
The most natural way to fill the blank in that sentence is:

  • The information was given to the police.

 why:

  • We use the past tense ("was given") because the act of giving the information happened at some point in the past.
  • "The police" is the recipient of the information.

questionsData.title: . Have the teacher …… you
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.

questionsData.title: …… I can smell something
. Ahmed …… married next week
questionsData.explain_answer:
Ahmed is getting married next week.

  • "Is getting" indicates that Ameen is in the process of becoming married.

Therefore, "is getting" is the most natural and grammatically correct way to express that Ahmed is going to be married soon.

questionsData.title: . Ali is …… than he looks
A bad workman always blames his tools .the underlined word is a/an……..
. I have got ….. money
.The two bank clerks blamed …… for the mistakes
The early bird catches the worm . The underlined word is a/an ......
questionsData.explain_answer:
The word "worm" in the proverb "the early bird catches the worm" is a noun.

It refers to the small, soft-bodied invertebrate that the early bird is trying to catch for food.

questionsData.title: .The suffix …… changes the word " accident" into an adjective
.It ……. be a kite. It's impossible
If you were in my position, what …… you do ?
. You should apply …. the job
he got a scholarship, he refused to travel……
. The café ….. at 7 : 30 in the morning everday
. Fatema …….. her key. She can't get into house
questionsData.explain_answer:
The best option to complete the sentence is: Has lost

Here's why:

Loses is present tense, which wouldn't make sense since Fatema currently can't get into the house.
Lose is also present tense, with the same issue.
Has lost is past perfect tense, indicating the action of losing the key happened before she can't get in. This makes the most sense for the situation.
Lost could technically work, but it's a bit weaker than "has lost" because it doesn't explicitly state when she lost the key.

questionsData.title: The water …… can you turn the cooker off ?
. One of the following words is a compound
questionsData.explain_answer:
A compound word is a word that is formed by combining two or more separate words together to create a new word with its own meaning..

Some examples of compound words include:

  1. Football (foot + ball)
  2. Blackboard (black + board)
  3. Sunflower (sun + flower)
  4. Raincoat (rain + coat)
  5. Firefly (fire + fly)
